threat.name: Unauthorized Modification of the Data Stores
threat.description: Other resource can temper the data at the data store unauthorizedly/unintentionally

threat.name: Sensitive Data Leakage
threat.description: Unintentionally exposes sensitive, protected, or confidential information outside its intended environment

threat.name: Denial of Service against a Data Store
threat.description: Violating the availability of the datastore

threat.name: Attacking the Logs
threat.description: Attacking (reading, tamperinng, etc.) the database (log files) to perform repudiation

threat.name: Other: Network Attacks To Cloud Application
threat.description: Remote side can perform remote malicious activities based on misconfiguration or vulnerabilities of the cloud application

threat.name: Other: Cloud Application Abuse
threat.description: Malicious usage (abuse) of cloud application from the Internet (e.g. sending spam, participating botnet, mining) after gain control on it

threat.name: Other: Malicious Insider In Cloud Infrastructure
threat.description: Malicious insider in cloud infrastructure causes security issues of cloud application

threat.name: Other: Loss Of Security Control
threat.description: Loss of visibility and control of security and privacy of cloud application (partially controlled)

threat.name: Other: Poor Information Security Processes
threat.description: Poor information security processes of cloud provider (design, implementation and operations)

threat.name: Other: Audit And Certification Issues
threat.description: Audit and certification of cloud applications and infrastructure are inaccessible or restricted

threat.name: Other: Security Issues Of SLA
threat.description: Incorrect or unclear information security section of SLA

threat.name: Other: Service Provider Lock-In
threat.description: Service provider lock-in

threat.name: Other: Software License Issues
threat.description: Software license issues

threat.name: Other: Restrictions Of Forensic Readiness
threat.description: Restrictions of forensic readiness for cloud applications (e.g. access to low-level logs and background data, disclosure of client context)

threat.name: Other: Destruction Of Data Center
threat.description: Natural disasters destroy data centre or cloud infrastructure (Force Majeure)

threat.name: Other: VM Escape
threat.description: VM suffers from process that escaped from another VM (VM Escape)

threat.name: Other: Cross-VM Side Channel
threat.description: VM suffers from a Cross-VM side channel attack

threat.name: Other: Hypervisor Vulnerabilities
threat.description: VM suffers from vulnerabilities of hypervisor

threat.name: Other: Rogue VM Image In Repository
threat.description: Uncontrolled placement of VM images (possibly with malicious content) in repository

threat.name: Other: Outdated VM Image In Repository
threat.description: Use of an outdated image for VM from repository

threat.name: Other: Lack Of Network Isolation
threat.description: Security issues of VM networking, caused by lack of network isolation

threat.name: Other: Unsafe VM Snapshots
threat.description: Security issues, related to management of VM snapshots

threat.name: Other: Host storage use
threat.description: The use of host storage is not recommended for production environments

threat.name: Other: Use of Container Socket
threat.description: The use of container socket (a raw management interface) is not recommended

threat.name: Other: Write Access to Volume
threat.description: Use of a volume in read-write mode when only the read access required (configuration, permanent data)

threat.name: Other: Data Leak at Storage
threat.description: Data may be stolen from volume or host storage

threat.name: Other: Data Corruption at Storage
threat.description: Data may be corrupted being on volume or host storage

threat.name: Other: Use container management tools
threat.description: Container management tools (API, CLI) can be illegally used to compromise a container.

threat.name: Other: Container Escape
threat.description: Compromised container can be used to get access to a host where the container has been run.

threat.name: Other: Container Privilege Escalation
threat.description: Escalation of privileges within a container.

threat.name: Other: Compromised Access Token
threat.description: Access Tokens (other credentials) used to authenticate a container can be compromised.

threat.name: Other: Data Leak At Transfer
threat.description: Containers use channels (virtual networks) to communicate each other as well as interact with remote users

threat.name: Other: Data Corruption At Transfer
threat.description: Containers use channels (virtual networks) to communicate each other as well as interact with remote users

threat.name: Other: Channel Destroyed
threat.description: Containers use channels (virtual networks) to communicate each other as well as interact with remote users

threat.name: Other: Access to container management interface
threat.description: Remote user can get access to container management interface (Web, CLI)

threat.name: Other: Exploit Published Network Application
threat.description: Open network port can be exploited in order to compromise container instance.

threat.name: Other: Deploy Malicious Container
threat.description: A container management system can be used to deploy containers that include malicious software.

threat.name: Other: Container Discovery
threat.description: Available containers and other resources can be discovered.

threat.name: Denial of Service: Failure Of Remote Service
threat.description: Unexpected failure of the remote service

threat.name: Denial of Service: Connection Lost To Remote Service
threat.description: Connection lost to the remote service

threat.name: Denial of Service: Failure Of Cloud Application
threat.description: Unexpected failure of the cloud application

threat.name: Denial of Service: Connection Lost To Cloud Application
threat.description: Connection lost to the cloud application

threat.name: Denial of Service: Backup Of Cloud Application Lost
threat.description: Lost of cloud application backup

threat.name: Denial of Service: DDoS Attack To Cloud Application
threat.description: DDoS/DoS attack against cloud application from the Internet

threat.name: Denial of Service: EDoS Attack To Cloud Application
threat.description: EDoS (Economic Denial of Sustainability or Economic Denial of Service) attack against cloud application from the Internet

threat.name: Denial of Service: Block Shared Resources Of Cloud Application
threat.description: Blocking shared resources of cloud application (e.g. shared external IP) by a third-part reputation service

threat.name: Denial of Service: Lack Of Reserved Resources For Cloud Application
threat.description: Lack of reserved resources for cloud application because of overload of cloud infrastructure

threat.name: Denial of Service: Failure Of Resource Scaling For Cloud Application
threat.description: Unexpected failure of resource scaling for cloud application

threat.name: Denial of Service: Hidden Dependencies Of Cloud Infrastructure
threat.description: Hidden dependencies between components of cloud application and cloud infrastructure cause security issues of cloud application

threat.name: Denial of Service: Confiscation Of Computer Hardware
threat.description: Confiscation of computer hardware of cloud provider as a result of subpoena by law-enforcement agencies

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Data Breach By Remote Service
threat.description: Data breach (information disclosure) by the remote service

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Malware From Cloud Application
threat.description: Malicious content (malware) from the cloud application

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Public Network Access To Cloud Application
threat.description: Remote user connects to the cloud application though a public network (e.g. Wi-Fi) and can be attacked by a third-party adversary

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Social Engineering Against Remote User
threat.description: Remote user suffers from Social Engineering attacks, performed by third-party adversary (e.g. including the cloud application into phishing schema)

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Data Breach By Cloud Application
threat.description: Data breach (information disclosure) by the cloud application

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Backup Of Cloud Application Stolen
threat.description: Disclosure of cloud application backups

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Logs Of Cloud Application Stolen
threat.description: Disclosure of sensitive information from cloud application logs

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Disclosure Of Credentials Of Cloud Management Interface
threat.description: Disclosure of user credentials of management interface of cloud application

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Lack Of Resource Isolation Of Cloud Application
threat.description: Lack of data, code, network isolation of cloud applications caused by misconfigurations and vulnerabilities of cloud infrastructure

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Confiscation Of Computer Hardware
threat.description: Confiscation of computer hardware of cloud provider as a result of subpoena by law-enforcement agencies

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Physical Access Or Theft Of Computer Equipment
threat.description: Unauthorized access or theft of computer equipment from data centre

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Network Scanning
threat.description: Network and port scanning, service and version detection of VM from Internet

threat.name: Information Disclosure: Unsafe VM Migration
threat.description: Loss or disclosure of information during VM migration

threat.name: Tampering: Data Loss By Remote Service
threat.description: Data loss (modification) by the remote service

threat.name: Tampering: Malware From Cloud Application
threat.description: Malicious content (malware) from the cloud application

threat.name: Tampering: Public Network Access To Cloud Application
threat.description: Remote user connects to the cloud application though a public network (e.g. Wi-Fi) and can be attacked by a third-party adversary

threat.name: Tampering: Data Loss By Cloud Application
threat.description: Data loss (modification) by the cloud application

threat.name: Tampering: Lack Of Resource Isolation Of Cloud Application
threat.description: Lack of data, code, network isolation of cloud applications caused by misconfigurations and vulnerabilities of cloud infrastructure

threat.name: Tampering: Remote Code Execution
threat.description: Remote code execution against network applications and services from Internet

threat.name: Tampering: Unsafe VM Migration
threat.description: Loss or disclosure of information during VM migration

threat.name: Elevation of Privilege: Broken Access Control
threat.description: No access control, broken (weak) access control, and the authorization issues of the cloud application

threat.name: Elevation of Privilege: Priviledge Escalation
threat.description: System services and applications suffer from privilege escalation

threat.name: Spoofing: Spoofing Of Remote Service
threat.description: Spoofing of the remote service

threat.name: Spoofing: Social Engineering Against Remote User
threat.description: Remote user suffers from Social Engineering attacks, performed by third-party adversary (e.g. including the cloud application into phishing schema)

threat.name: Spoofing: Broken Authentication
threat.description: No authentication or broken (weak) authentication by the cloud application

threat.name: Repudiation: Logs Of Cloud Application Lost
threat.description: Lost of cloud application logs
